--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Neil Swingler" <neil@n...> wrote:
| Subject: Re: Recursive TestRunner -- one implementation
> Did you see my submission in the files section, using javassist
> to insert imposter mock classes using a custom classloader. I
> also have a Test object which delegates to a test created in a
> new classloader.

Most interesting!

It got me really excited, ...until I found that JBuilder's support 
for JUnit tests is brain-dead!^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h^h provides 
a wonderful opportunity for them to improve their integration with 
JUnit -- to enable full use of JUnit functionality.  ;->    JBuilder 
doesn't understand the static suite() methods, and gets completely 
lost when the ReloadedTestCaseDecorator Decorator pattern instances 
actually make it into the tests.

I posted the question to Borland's public news group for integration 
with 3rd party tools.  We'll see what they have to say about it.



http://newsgroups.borland.com/cgi-bin/dnewsweb?
